citation.article-title: Roseicyclus mahoneyensis gen. nov., sp. nov., an aerobic phototrophic bacterium isolated from a meromictic lake.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Roseicyclus (Ro.se.i.cyc′lus. L. adj. roseus rose, pink; L. masc. n. cyclus cycle; N.L. masc. n. Roseicyclus pink cyclic bacterium).
Cells are Gram-negative and are ovoid to elongated rods, vibrioid or almost cyclical.
Produce pointed enlarged areas of the periplasm located at the poles.
Divide by means of symmetric or asymmetric constrictions.
Cultures are pink–purple to purple due to the production of carotenoids and Bchl a.
Produce both LH1 complex, with an absorption peak at 870–871 nm, and an interesting LH2 complex with one absorption peak at 805–806 nm.
No growth occurs anaerobically in the light.
Obligately aerobic; no fermentation or dissimilatory denitrification observed.
The habitat of the first isolated strains is a saline, Na2SO4-dominated lake.
The type species is Roseicyclus mahoneyensis.
